metadata.name: Is this role being posted for the immigration team?

title: Associate Director Product Manager
content:
Our Opportunity:
 
Chewy is seeking an Associate Director of Product Management to join the Content Platform team in either our Seattle, Minneapolis, Boston, or Fort Lauderdale office. This product leader will own the end-to-end product vision and roadmap for Chewy’s Customer Segmentation and Content Competition platforms. In this high-impact role, you will be responsible for defining a vision and initiatives to help pet parents get the information they need to make the best purchasing decisions for their pets. You will partner with engineering, design, data science, and analytics, and other product and business leaders across Chewy to build customer-focused experiences and drive the growth of our business. We are looking for a product leader with a strong sense of ownership and experience delivering impactful customer experiences.
 
What You’ll Do:
 

Use your customer-first mindset to guide the development and delivery of best-in-class customer experiences
Define and analyze measures of success (KPIs) for new features and enhancements; transform these customer and business insights into clear requirements for product enhancements and new features.
Develop and maintain a roadmap and prioritized product backlog ensuring product vision aligns with both customer and business goals
Create objectives and define cadences to track performance of your product(s) and measure impact of product enhancements; communicate impact clearly across the organization and use to drive prioritization
Collaborate with engineering, design, data science, and analytics resources to deliver features with strong customer and business value

What You’ll Need:
 

8+ years of product management experience


Bachelor's degree


Excellent analytical skills with demonstrated experience turning data into actionable insights.


Experience with feature delivery and tradeoffs of a product
Experience owning/driving roadmap strategy and definition
Experience with end-to-end product delivery
Experience contributing to engineering discussions around technology decisions and strategy related to a product


Aptitude to analyze, communicate and present metrics effectively to support recommendations.


Ability to think creatively, execute on a roadmap, build consensus and momentum


Strong writing and verbal communication at the executive level

Bonus:

Background/experience with ML and data science
Experience in eCommerce


Strong communication skills


Fluency in SQL and/or Tableau


Compensation & Benefits:
Our salary range for an Associate Director Product Manager position is $156,000 - $255,000. The specific salary offered to a candidate may be influenced by a variety of factors including but not limited to the candidate’s relevant experience, education, and work location. In addition, this position is eligible for 401k and a new hire and annual equity grant.
We offer different types of insurance, such as medical/Rx, vision, dental, life, disability, hospital indemnity, critical illness, and accident. We offer parental leave, family services benefits, backup dependent care, flexible spending accounts, telemedicine, pet adoption reimbursement, employee assistance program, and many discounts including 10% off pet insurance and 20% off at Chewy.com.
Non-exempt hourly team members accrue paid time off (PTO) while salaried-exempt team members have unlimited PTO, subject to manager approval. Non-exempt hourly team members in Fulfillment Centers and Customer Service are also eligible for additional unplanned unpaid time off (UTO). Team members will receive six paid holidays per year. Team members may be eligible for paid sick and family leave in compliance with applicable state and local regulations.
Chewy is committed to equal opportunity. We value and embrace diversity and inclusion of all Team Members. If you have a disability under the Americans with Disabilities Act or similar law, and you need an accommodation during the application process or to perform these job requirements, or if you need a religious accommodation, please contact CAAR@chewy.com.
 
If you have a question regarding your application, please contact HR@chewy.com.
 
To access Chewy's Customer Privacy Policy, please click here. To access Chewy's California CPRA Job Applicant Privacy Policy, please click here.

questions.label: Internal purposes only - no need to answer *
Arbitration Agreement Signed?
Arbitration Agreement Signed Date

Deloitte is Chewy’s independent auditor. To not impair Deloitte's independence, Chewy must validate the role of any current or former Deloitte employee against any exempt role they are interviewing for at Chewy. Do you currently work for Deloitte or have you ever been employed by Deloitte in the past?

Close family ties to a Deloitte employee could also impair Deloitte’s independence as Chewy’s auditor should you become employed by Chewy.  Do you have a close family member (spouse or equivalent, parent, dependent, non-dependent child, and/or sibling) that currently works for Deloitte?
